intro: Ellipanthus burebidensis, commonly known as the Burebidense ellipanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is of great interest to botanists and conservationists.
